verses.text: Rescue me, O LORD, from evil men; protect me from men of violence,

rsbNotes.title: Ps 140
rsbNotes.text: Ps. 140 This psalm is a complaint, which characteristically turns to the Lord at the end with confidence (vv. 12, 13).

verses.text: who devise evil plans in their hearts and stir up war every day.

rsbNotes.title: Ps 140:2
rsbNotes.text: 140:2 stir up wars. Taken literally, this language suggests that the original setting of the psalm was war. Probably the language is figurative, like the reference to hunting in v. 5.

verses.text: They make their tongues as sharp as a serpent's; the poison of vipers is on their lips. Selah
Keep me, O LORD, from the hands of the wicked; protect me from men of violence who plan to trip my feet.
Proud men have hidden a snare for me; they have spread out the cords of their net and have set traps for me along my path. Selah
O LORD, I say to you, "You are my God." Hear, O LORD, my cry for mercy.

rsbNotes.title: Ps 140:3
rsbNotes.text: 140:3 venom of asps. The enemy, through gossip and slander, has carefully planned the writer’s destruction.

verses.text: O Sovereign LORD, my strong deliverer, who shields my head in the day of battle-
do not grant the wicked their desires, O LORD; do not let their plans succeed, or they will become proud. Selah

rsbNotes.title: Ps 140:7
rsbNotes.text: 140:7 in the day of battle. See v. 2 note. The psalmist reminds God that He has been his protector.

verses.text: Let the heads of those who surround me be covered with the trouble their lips have caused.

rsbNotes.title: Ps 140:9
rsbNotes.text: 140:9 mischief of their lips. He asks God to turn back on his persecutors the evil they meant for him (7:14–16 notes).

verses.text: Let burning coals fall upon them; may they be thrown into the fire, into miry pits, never to rise.
Let slanderers not be established in the land; may disaster hunt down men of violence.

rsbNotes.title: Ps 140:10
rsbNotes.text: 140:10 Let them be cast into fire. See Introduction: Characteristics and Themes.

verses.text: I know that the LORD secures justice for the poor and upholds the cause of the needy.
Surely the righteous will praise your name and the upright will live before you.

rsbNotes.title: Ps 140:12
rsbNotes.text: 140:12 will maintain the cause of the afflicted. See 9:18 note; 72:4.
